items.title: OpenAI's computing deals with Nvidia, AMD, Oracle, and others have topped $1T, commitments that dwarf its revenue and raise questions about how it can fund them (Financial Times)
bullets: OpenAI's computing deals hit $1 trillion.
Commitments far exceed its current revenue.
Raises questions about OpenAI's funding strategy.
Partners include Nvidia, AMD, and Oracle.
items.why_it_matters: This highlights the enormous investment needed for advanced AI development and raises concerns about OpenAI's long-term financial viability and funding strategy.

items.title: MrBeast, who earned an estimated $85M in 2025, says AI-generated videos could threaten creators' livelihoods, calling it "scary times" for the industry (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
bullets: MrBeast warns AI videos threaten creator incomes.
Calls it 'scary times' for the creative industry.
Despite concerns, he has used AI technology himself.
items.why_it_matters: A top YouTube creator's concern highlights the growing impact of AI on the creator economy and potential threats to content creators' livelihoods.

items.title: Apps in ChatGPT could be OpenAI's most ambitious platform play to date, drawing parallels with Facebook's 2007 efforts to become a platform via social graph (Casey Newton/Platformer)
bullets: ChatGPT apps seen as OpenAI's big platform move.
Compared to Facebook's 2007 platform launch.
Aims to build a comprehensive ecosystem around ChatGPT.
items.why_it_matters: This indicates OpenAI's strategic shift to become a foundational platform, potentially transforming how users interact with AI and integrate it into daily applications.

items.title: Qualtrics agrees to acquire Press Ganey Forsta, which helps healthcare companies compile feedback from patients and doctors, for $6.75B including debt (Financial Times)
bullets: Qualtrics to acquire Press Ganey Forsta.
Deal valued at $6.75 billion (including debt).
PGF specializes in healthcare feedback solutions.
Latest in a series of healthcare tech acquisitions.
items.why_it_matters: This significant acquisition expands Qualtrics' market presence in the healthcare sector, reflecting a strong trend in private equity-backed software and healthcare-focused tech deals.

items.title: Google launches a dedicated AI bug bounty program that offers security researchers up to $30,000 for finding vulnerabilities in its AI products (Elissa Welle/The Verge)
bullets: Google starts a specific AI bug bounty.
Offers up to $30,000 for critical AI vulnerabilities.
Rewards finding ways to command 'rogue actions' from AI.
Focuses on strengthening AI product security.
items.why_it_matters: This shows Google's commitment to enhancing AI safety and security by incentivizing ethical hackers to identify and report potential flaws in its AI systems.

items.title: Oracle urges customers to patch an E-Business Suite vulnerability that is being exploited by cybercriminals; Mandiant says the Clop hacking group exploited it (Jonathan Greig/The Record)
bullets: Oracle urges users to patch E-Business Suite vulnerability.
Vulnerability actively exploited by cybercriminals.
Mandiant identifies Clop hacking group as exploiters.
Immediate patching is critical for security.
items.why_it_matters: This is a critical security alert requiring urgent action to protect Oracle E-Business Suite users from active exploitation by a known cybercriminal group.
key_commands: Apply the latest security patch for Oracle E-Business Suite immediately.
caveats: Failure to patch could lead to data breaches or system compromise.
Verify patch compatibility and backup systems before deployment.

items.title: OpenAI unveils the Apps SDK, built on MPC, in preview to let developers build apps for ChatGPT, and says it will begin accepting app submissions later this year (Carl Franzen/VentureBeat)
bullets: OpenAI launched a new SDK for developers.
It allows building apps for ChatGPT.
App submissions open later this year.
SDK is currently in preview mode.
items.why_it_matters: This opens ChatGPT to a wider ecosystem of third-party applications, making the AI platform more versatile and integrated. It signals OpenAI's move towards an app store-like model for AI.

items.title: OpenAI announces apps that work inside ChatGPT, starting with Booking.com, Canva, Coursera, Figma, Expedia, Spotify, and Zillow for users outside of the EU (OpenAI)
bullets: ChatGPT now integrates third-party apps.
Initial partners: Booking.com, Canva, Spotify, Expedia, others.
Available for users outside the EU.
A new generation of chat-enabled apps.
items.why_it_matters: This brings immediate utility to ChatGPT, allowing users to perform tasks like booking travel or creating designs directly through the AI, enhancing its capabilities beyond just conversation.

items.title: SCOTUS turns down Google's request to halt key parts of a judge's order requiring Google to make major changes to Play Store in an antitrust case filed by Epic (Mike Scarcella/Reuters)
bullets: SCOTUS denied Google's appeal.
Google must change its Play Store.
Order from Epic Games' antitrust suit.
Affects how Google manages its app store.
items.why_it_matters: This is a significant blow to Google's control over the Play Store, potentially leading to more openness and competition in the Android app ecosystem. It could empower developers and offer users more choices.

items.title: Cerebras CEO Andrew Feldman says the AI chipmaker pulled its IPO filing to share updated financials, admitting it was a mistake not to explain the move sooner (Jordan Novet/CNBC)
bullets: Cerebras pulled its IPO filing.
Aims to share updated financials.
CEO admitted poor communication.
Company still plans to go public.
items.why_it_matters: This temporary withdrawal raises questions about Cerebras's financial health or market timing, but the CEO's clarification aims to reassure investors of future IPO plans for the AI chip market.

items.title: Sources: the SEC has been probing AppLovin over allegations that it violated platform partners' agreements to push more targeted ads to consumers; APP drops 14% (Olivia Solon/Bloomberg)
bullets: SEC is probing AppLovin.
Allegations: violated partner agreements.
Pushed more targeted ads.
AppLovin stock dropped 14%.
Probe concerns data practices.
items.why_it_matters: An SEC probe and stock drop signal serious regulatory and financial risks for AppLovin, highlighting increased scrutiny on data privacy and advertising practices in the tech industry.

items.title: OpenAI announces API updates, including GPT-5 Pro, Sora 2 in preview, and gpt-realtime-mini, a voice model that is 70% cheaper than gpt-realtime (Rebecca Bellan/TechCrunch)
bullets: OpenAI updated its API.
Introduced GPT-5 Pro language model.
Sora 2 video generation model in preview.
New, cheaper voice model: gpt-realtime-mini.
Aims for more powerful, cost-effective AI.
items.why_it_matters: These updates provide developers with more advanced, diverse, and potentially more affordable AI tools, driving innovation in areas like sophisticated language processing, video creation, and real-time voice applications.

items.title: Bee Maps, a decentralized mapping project powered by Hivemapper on the Solana blockchain, raised $32M to expand its network by distributing AI-enabled dashcams (CoinDesk)
bullets: Bee Maps secured $32M in funding.
It's a decentralized mapping project on Solana blockchain.
Uses AI-enabled dashcams for data collection.
Aims to expand its global mapping network.
items.why_it_matters: This funding will help scale a Web3 alternative to traditional mapping services, leveraging blockchain and AI to offer more current and globally distributed map data.

items.title: OpenAI makes Codex generally available, and announces new features: Slack integration, a new Codex SDK, and new admin tools (OpenAI)
bullets: OpenAI's Codex is now generally available (GA).
New features include Slack integration.
A new Codex SDK has been released.
New admin tools for managing Codex are available.
items.why_it_matters: General availability and new tools make Codex more accessible and practical for developers, accelerating AI-assisted coding and software development for engineering teams.

items.title: OpenAI launches AgentKit, a toolkit for building and deploying AI agents, including Agent Builder, which Sam Altman described as like Canva for building agents (Rebecca Bellan/TechCrunch)
bullets: OpenAI launched AgentKit at its Dev Day event.
It's a toolkit for creating and deploying AI agents.
Includes 'Agent Builder,' likened to Canva for agents.
Aims to help developers build and ship AI agents easily.
items.why_it_matters: AgentKit simplifies AI agent development, potentially democratizing access to advanced AI applications and enabling more users to build custom AI tools with a user-friendly interface.
